nodes.bodyText: Maybe rename these fields? string and regex for example 😃
I think you can just use Expression#getArray here. The returned arrays won't be null, but they may be empty.
👍  okay
Will do, thanks
I would make using matches required. Using just match sound weird to me. Are there any situations where using match would be better though?
Yeah, in %strings% match %string%

Yeah but %strings% means multiple ones
"hello" and "hey" match "\d+"

Woops! I read your original message as %string% match %string%, not %strings% match %string%
Sorry lol
Shouldn't this be Pattern[] patterns?
Yeah but apparently Object[] can't be cast to Pattern[] and I haven't found anything that returns an array of patterns from the Stream
See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/stream/Stream.html#toArray-java.util.function.IntFunction-

Are you sure you want to use Matcher#find() here and not Matcher#matches()?
Also, you're using allMatch for both of these, but I think that should be dependant on whether it's an and list or an or list (see https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript/blob/master/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/lang/Expression.java#L76)
Yeah, I already asked in the skript-chat discord server whether or not skript would automatically do something based on whether or not and or 'or' were used, and since nobody answered I didn't know
Thanks
Also I wanted to use Matcher.find() because .matches() matches the entire string and I don't want it to have to match that. Users can just use ^ and $ to match the beginning and end

Also I wanted to use Matcher.find() because .matches() matches the entire string and I don't want it to have to match that. Users can just use ^ and $ to match the beginning and end

In that case you should probably think about the syntax again, because %string% matches %string% implies that one string matches some regex pattern, AKA the whole string matches some regex pattern, not a part of the given string (%string% partially matches %string% maybe, and if you're going for something like that, you should make partially optional to either match the full string or part of it)
Pattern compilation can be computationally expensive... does this compile all the pattern strings once only? Or does it do a compilation every comparison?
I'll run a few tests
Yeah, the new method will be better
A few more tests would be nice... matching uuid? etc

nodes.bodyText: Full stop here
What's the rationale behind using a parallel stream here?
It's not that needed in this case but parallel streams are faster than sequential ones in general, as they run tasks on different threads
i'm not sure that it's worth it
Yeah, I don't know whether or not it is
IMO, you should just surround matches and doesn't match, but that's more of my formatting opinion
What do you mean?
Oh, it was a nitpicky comment, I just meant to do " matches " and " doesn’t " instead of the + " ", but looking at it now I don’t think it really matters
Whitespace 😨

In my opinion, I feel this description is quite lacklustre.
I know that you have regex matching available here, but there is absolutely no mention of it. I recommend updating the description to give more detail on what this condition actually does.

It mentioned regular expressions though, do you mean explaining what regex is? If so the description would need to be way longer, and some people learn by reading the docs, others by watching YouTube tutorials, so doing that wouldn’t really be helpful, at most what could be done would be to link a few resources
No, regex doesn't need to be explained, but it isn't mentioned at all. If someone where to open the docs and search for "regex", they're not going to find anything, since its not mentioned here.
But regular expression and regex mean the same thing
Not everyone knows that.... again, as I've said, if someone SEARCHES the word "regex" they aren't going to find any results.

Am I crazy, or is this backwards?
(isNegated() ? "matches" : "doesn't match")
